website_summaries.verdict: Very popular unisex 38-millimeter analog watch with colorful nylon band available in assorted colors.
pros: No-fuss, nylon strap with analog quartz movement showing 24-hour military time
cons: Few complaints about short battery life and apparent loudness of ticking

customer_reviews.title: Revised review: about those water resistance claims
customer_reviews.text: Watch is okay, as long as you're not buying it for the water resistance. Industry designations for water resistance are very misleading: this watch is rated to 30 meters. Who knew that meant it was only intended for water exposure during light rain and occasional handwashing?! The "reasonable person" standard does not apply here (i.e., I'm not scuba diving to a depth of 30 meters, hence this should cover me), so buyer beware! If you're looking for a watch that can actually get wet, research well the industry's water resistance designations (even if you don't live under the sea!) so you can choose a product that will actually meet your needs and not be dissappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bredero

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful watch poor build quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch less than 1 month ago. It is not keeping time. I've had to set the time twice in two days. When I set the time I noticed the knob pulls right out. I've never seen that happen even on the cheapest watches. Beautiful watch poor build quality. A first Timex fail for me. I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Flandreau

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this idiotic watch with the black dial and silver hands.
customer_reviews.text: Did an intern design this watch? Not reviewing the movement or reliability of this watch, only the design. The brown/black version (with black face and silvery metallic hands) is incredibly hard to read, depending on where you are, what the light / sun situation is, what room you're in, or the angle of reflection. The silver hands reflect light back at you, like two thin mirrors. This is fine if you're outside. under broad daylight. But if you're inside, or in your car, or holding the watch angled toward you such that the sun doesn't hit it at the exact correct angle, it's like having a watch with black hands against a black dial.
customer_reviews.author: H2C

customer_reviews.title: lasted about 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch after having a Timex Weekender that I purchased from a department store. My old Timex was great lasted me years until I accidentally broke it. I wanted another one so I purchased one on Amazon but I don't think it's a real Timex. The strap got warped after a couple of weeks so I swapped it out. Then my indiglo stop working after about 3 weeks. I was getting condensation and then after about 10 weeks the watch was completely dead. I'm really disappointed because it was a nice looking watch but it's cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Clara

customer_reviews.title: For all your professional unisex needs
customer_reviews.text: I alternate between pretty butch and femme styles and wanted a watch that would look confidently professional on medical rounds. I was concerned that this watch would be *too* big for my 5.5" wrist, but for my style it's perfect. At this size, it's easy to get many other kinds of bands, including a nice leather one (shown in one of the pictures.) I like that I can change it up easily, and even quickly dispose of a band if it gets blood on it or something. Maybe not for everyone, but I hope these pictures can help other people with petite wrists order with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Líf

customer_reviews.title: Watch Broke in a few days.
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to find an inexpensive, basic, no-frills Timex with an Indiglo backlight. However, the adjustment stem broke off somehow with no hard handling or abuse. I wasn't adjusting it, I just looked down to check the time and noticed the problem. What concerns me is that I bought this watch to replace another of the same model that broke in exactly the same way. That one was only a couple of months old, just out of the date range for a return. I have owned other Timex watches for years with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I am a Nursing assistant and had to get a second hand watch. In the West coast - we wear watches less and less these days due to our cell phones. I wanted a large face and changeable band where in the future I can purchase Multiple color bands to match my future scrubs collection. I love the fact that I can see the time in the dark. A great experience is in the movie theaters ... Taking out my phone and having a big screen glow to tell the time .. I don't want the theater thinking that I am filming the movie or taking pictures. So this is a great - little gem.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great for nursing students
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. I’m a woman, and/but I don’t care for the tiny faced watches that are marketed to women. I get tons of compliments on this from men and women. I also just started nursing school, and the large face, “military” time, and glow features are super helpful for taking pulses and respiratory rates in dimly lit hospital rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Class and Survivibility
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted a simple watch for the wrist for easy at a glance. This watch delivered, and then some: Nice and simple fabric strap which stays mostly clean. Easy to read dial and hands. Indiglo for easy night time checks. Water resistant to 30m. Here isy story for the water resistance. Over the summer, I spent 10 days in the Caribbean, and never took this watch off once. Each day, hours of snorkeling, beaching, or hiking. This guy still looks new. Value is fantastic, consider purchasing this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Slatu

customer_reviews.title: Loud ticking not a problem. Works with small wrist.
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about loud ticking because of other reviews, but this is not a problem for me, and I have really good hearing, and misophonia. I cannot hear it unless I put it right up to my ear. Maybe this is a problem that was corrected. I love the color of the face and how easy it is to read. The band is very long so I cut it off and cauterized it with super glue. You can see in the picture what that looks like. I also have it folded over at the end. The indiglo is wonderful for telling time in the middle of the night! The light only comes on when you press the button.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Michalak

customer_reviews.title: Best to upgrade to an Expedition Scout
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, I was warned that this is a loud watch; No kidding; IT IS really loud. You probably won't hear all the time but if you are in a library or any quiet room you will definitely hear the tick and the tocks. Secondly, I don't really like the strap it comes with. Lastly, I recommend one of the watches with a white or cream face. I ordered a grey face and the backlighting does not look as awesome as in the pictures. I wished I had upgraded to the expedition Scout.
customer_reviews.author: ElegantEngineer

customer_reviews.title: Broken watch
customer_reviews.text: The watch was delivered in a timely manner. Upon opening the package I loved the large dial with easy to read numerals. I removed the plastic piece so the watch would start. That is it for good news. I have never been disappointed in a Timex watch before today, that changed today. The watch does not work You cannot move the hands to correct the time. So this watch will only give the correct time twice in a 24 hour period
customer_reviews.author: Grady Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Yet High Quality Quartz Watch
customer_reviews.text: Timex watches are inexpensive yet high quality. The second hand lines up exactly with the markers on the chapter ring. I've seen Swiss made watches costing three times more that don't have this level of quality. Bold numbers and thick black hands on a cream dial make this watch super easy to read: easier than many larger watches. Small size is light and comfortable. No date complication, however the Indiglo built-in night light is crazy awesome. Nylon strap is comfortable and easy to replace if it's ever needed. Water resistance is good, yet the general recommendation is don't swim with a watch unless it has a 100M (330 feet) or higher rating.
customer_reviews.author: JP KazarianTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: No internal battery. Description not clear.
customer_reviews.text: This watch would be fine except that it needs to be worn daily or it loses time and needs to be re-set. It does not have an internal battery. For that reason, the watch is totally useless to me. I cannot recommend anyone purchase this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Upshaw

customer_reviews.title: Great first watch.
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. If you’re just getting into watches and you are overwhelmed by the deluge of conflicting opinions and snobbery, just start with this one. I stopped wearing a watch 12 years ago when someone convinced me I only need my cell phone. I also only used to wear digital watches, so this is a change for me in that way too. But, there was no courage needed to introduce this new accessory to my daily wear as with other accessories because it goes with almost anything I put on. I’ve heard of people getting irritated with the loud ticking that becomes apparent in a quiet room, but I find it oddly soothing.
customer_reviews.author: J. C

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Nice little watch.. pleasing to my sense of design... functional in it's simplicity and accuracy. Also very affordable for an everyday 'wear around the house' kind of timepiece. Watch's internal movement does emit a faint but audible click but very hard to notice unless in a VERY quiet, vault like or virtually noiseless environment. Personally, this is not an issue but could be to some... perhaps those very sensitive to any kind of extraneous sound(s). Overall... a very cost effective purchase with solid utility for the reason bought.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Sproul

customer_reviews.title: A devil of a time...
customer_reviews.text: ...trying to get the time; had purchased the watch with the black face/black strap; not sure if will keep, as hard to see the hour and minutes hands; they seem to appear/reflect as gunmetal upon viewing; only the second hand really stands out, which tends to be frustrating when trying to see the time; those hands should have been white like the numbers of the dial, because as they are now, they blend right in with the face of the watch; for me personally, that is a huge design flaw; will be ordering one with a white face, and probably be returning this one; too bad, as is a sharp looking watch otherwise
customer_reviews.author: Sharby ~ The Beautiful Berkshires

customer_reviews.title: Timex keeps on ticking
customer_reviews.text: Times is a step up from my usual watch purchases. I actually buy a watch based on the band. I always buy cheap watches because when the battery stops, I just throw it away & buy a new one. But, I like the fabric bands & it's not always easy to find. The Timex had a great selection of bands & this one suits me well. I also like the numeral display on the watch. I never purchase the more modern ones without numbers. The light is okay, but almost never used. My usual watch purchase is about $10 - this one was 3 times that. Timex is always good, but I'll wait to see if it's worth the difference.
customer_reviews.author: old fashioned

customer_reviews.title: Loses time after a month
customer_reviews.text: I wore this watch daily for about a month with no issues. Then one morning I realized that the time was about 30min off. I set it correctly, but an hour later it had lost 2 minutes. I had the battery replaced in case that was the issue, but it continues to lose time. If it kept time (it's sole purpose) I'd give it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS WATCH!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this watch back in Dec 2018. I am so very happy with it! I wear it constantly every day & to bed. The only time it comes off is for showering. The band is great...sturdy, comfortable, looks good (olive color). It is wearing very well. I just bought another one in the same color to wear for dress up + also purchased two more in different color bands. I like big faced watches & this is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: MEW

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, but poorly built
customer_reviews.text: Poor build quality. I love the way this watch looks, but I've ordered two of them so far, and neither have lasted more than a couple of months. In the case of this one, the rod which holds the watch onto its band just snapped off a few days outside of the return window. To get it repaired by Timex, I'd have to ship it myself and enclose a check to pay for their service and return shipping. It would honestly be easier to just by another watch. I think I've learned my lesson though, so perhaps I'll be checking out a different one this time.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, but battery died and then it leaked almost right away
customer_reviews.text: The watch looks good, but is heard to read unless the light hits the arms just right. The Indiglo stopped working in just a couple of weeks, then battery died one month into ownership. I had the battery replaced, but then it took on water and stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: M. Russell

customer_reviews.title: very happy with new watch
customer_reviews.text: I am a woman in a fatsuit -- obesity, small hands and feet with stout wrists and ankles. The watchband had a lot to do with my choice of buying this watch. And yes, the band fits, nicely, and it is leather. Maybe not expensive leather, but that was not the point. Also my eyes are not what they were, with age, and the large size of the watch makes it easy to read. I'm really not that hard to please ... but there are a lot of watches out there that don't please me, and this one really does. I don't mind the ticking noise either.
customer_reviews.author: bmuse

customer_reviews.title: By far, the most comfortable watch I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch! Its simplicity and comfort cannot be beat. I have gotten so I often do not like a watch on my wrist. I have a handful of other watches that I like, but I find myself scrambling to take them off at some point later the day because I do not like the feel of them on my wrist. With this watch, I barely notice that it is on my wrist. And it is so soft and comfortable, with a simple-yet-sleek design that I like very much. Buy this watch! You won't be sorry you did!
customer_reviews.author: M. Bowyer

customer_reviews.title: Simple, accurate watch.
customer_reviews.text: I have used Timex watches for many years. I have more expensive watches, I have the go fit pro things that I wear sometimes too. This watch keeps accurate time, I don't have to worry about destroying this watch as I work or camp, or play because it's a cheap watch. It keeps accurate time. If I want to know the time and it's dark, it light up. It doesn't tell google, or apple or anybody else where I am or where I've been. It doesn't tell my heart rate, my altitude, my blood pressure, etc. It tells time and does it well.
customer_reviews.author: RDRR

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my friend as a b-day gift. I had the watch for a week 1/2 before sending it to her. I I love it. Looks great, lightweight, keeps PERFECT time. I mean perfect. The light is great. Timex is a good watch. I have a wind up one for a decade or two and it still works. The parts of Euro origin- Germany etc.. and Asian made or something, , assembled in the Netherlands. Great watch. I want one!!!! I may get the cream/olive band. Good luck and enjoy it if you get it. ~DM PS--My friend loves it!
customer_reviews.author: D. Meola

customer_reviews.title: Lasts forever. Waterproof, simple, functional, perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Man, I love this thing. It's way too difficult to find a waterproof watch with a simple watch face, actual numbers, and no extra dials. I'm the kind of person who never takes my watch off (even in the tub) and this one holds up wonderfully. It's lasted longer than Fossil watches I owned previously. The indiglo is just the cherry on top. It's such a pleasant color. Comes in handy as a night shift nurse while trying to be stealthy and count respirations without waking up my patients. I wish it came with a leather strap, but I'll take what I can get.
customer_reviews.author: Aurelia

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly practical
customer_reviews.text: Very practical watch. My wrist is 6.25” & had to cut about an inch off because the strap was too long. The color is more of a fatigue green than the celery green (which I prefer.) I’m not used to wearing any watch or jewelry so it feels very slightly heavy on my wrist. It appears to be well made! The dial is not a pure white. Easy to set & love the light feature. The box was a little crushed because it was just shipped in a bubble mailer so if you’re buying it as a gift that’s something to keep in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch -- Terrible Band
customer_reviews.text: The watch is great. It doesn't tick loudly, no matter what people say. I need to put it up to my ear to hear it. The band stinks. Literally. I got it wet and now it smells horrible, and the color has bled out. It also gave me a severe rash on my wrist, and I have triple antibiotic ointment on it and a huge bandage. It must be the dye in the watchband; maybe I'm allergic or maybe it's toxic. I have ordered a leather band which should get here in a few days and will hopefully not cause a bad reaction. I will just have to be extra careful and not accidentally get it wet!
customer_reviews.author: Louisa

customer_reviews.title: Killer Bargain
customer_reviews.text: Great price, even better value! Originally bought for work, wanted something that I could wear in a warehouse environment that I would feel bad if it got damaged but still looked good. Looks very clean, the back light lights the whole face vary well. It looks like it’s worth more than $25. The band is perfect for summer and keeps the watch very light and comfortable. They also sell multiple colors and design as well. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Wildcat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for work use!
customer_reviews.text: I work in a lab & do a lot of manual labor. This is just what I needed. The price and having military time on the face was the initial selling point, although I have grown to love the fabric band - I frequently shower with it to do a quick cleaning. Pro tip: It isn't as sturdy as my leather banded watches that I don't want to wear in the lab and iI've found that my lab coat/sleeves push it against my wrist bone uncomfortably - my fix has been to wear the face on the internal side of my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Beautiful Tulip

customer_reviews.title: Had to be returned and reordered
customer_reviews.text: This Timex watch met what I was what I was looking for in outward appearance; however, it stopped working after running for 7 minutes; after that it showed the correct time twice a day. Since it was what I was looking for in terms of style and price, I ordered it again; I am hopeful that the new one will work. The return process took considerable effort ... so far about 2 hours ... I remain hopeful that the replacement will operate the way I expect Timex watches to work.
customer_reviews.author: G. C. Carter

customer_reviews.title: She loves it so I love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch for my wife who is house bond (mostly) due to a stroke. She had a small watch to it was impossible for her to see the time any longer. I bought her another watch and it worked until the sun went down and you couldn't see it. So I order this watch that has a large face with a light background and black hands for good contrast. It is also water resistant so if she forget to take it off before a shower she had a little protection. She loves it so I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Weatherly

customer_reviews.title: Great every day watch
customer_reviews.text: Packaged in a sleek black box on a translucent stand, the Weekender is a great affordable everyday wear watch. The Pros 1) press button backlight is bright 2) the dial is easy to read at a quick glance 3) the band is comfortable and has many levels of adjustment 4) I love the fact that it has military time as well The Cons 1) the button/adjustment dial came completely out when I tried to first adjust it. I was expecting it to pull out further. 2) I'd like it if the backlight also "charged" the numbers while illuminated at night so that after the button is let go, the numbers stay illuminated. Great watch and great price overall
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed I guess sometimes I take a licking and keep on ticking
customer_reviews.text: I got this watch for my dad he's was 88 he never took it off . And at 91 he passed the watch sat on his dresser for 3 years and much to my surprise I found it still running I thought it was a little beat up so I decided to give it a little cleanup and surprise it looks like new oh and by the way the time was right on and no I didn't reset it for daylight savings time. I was very impressed so I bought myself one I have many watches from 200 to 3500 and few watches impress me more
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Takes a Lickin' and Keeps on Tickin'
customer_reviews.text: This watch is very durable and functional. It is not fancy - no day or date, no moon phases or stop-watch/timer features. It doesn't show international time or other time zones. What it does is function well to tell you the time of day. Plus feature is night light with the touch of the stem. No searching for your phone in the dark! Holds up for this horse farm gal scrubbing water troughs and bathing horses. Large, simple face you can see easily without your glasses!
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Five stars all day and all night.
customer_reviews.text: When this watch arrived and got to look it over, start it, check the light, it occurred to me this watch seemed to be of equal quality to Timex watches of 35-40 years ago; which I did not expect. Started it a week ago and just checked it's time and it seems to be dead on. The light is not too bright and not too dull and looks cool against a cool colored background. Walmart wanted $37.00 for this watch, plus state and city tax. My Amazon bill was $31.20 delivered. Five stars all day and all night.
customer_reviews.author: William Y.

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Watch
customer_reviews.text: Plan to use this watch for camping and road trips, because the indiglo face improves nighttime visibility. The watch face is larger and heavier than most women's watches, but not uncomfortable. I have a 6" wrist, which is small, but the watchband has 12 holes, so I had no problem finding a snug fit. Be aware this watch has a loud tick, which I enjoy but might aggravate others. I am pleased with this purchase; a little positive nostalgia throwback for the Timex watches of my youth...
customer_reviews.author: Linzleh

customer_reviews.title: Elegant, quality, and rugged watch!
customer_reviews.text: I usually only own / wear one watch at a time and stick with mid-grade in terms of quality and price. I didn't have the highest expectations for this watch, due to the price but was pleasantly surprised. The colors and appearance are exactly as pictured. The band fits my narrow, boney wrists but there's still plenty of room to tighten or loosen. The watch face isn't too large or small. It hides dirt well and hasn't gotten any scratches yet, even with frequent wear during horse work. I have gotten several compliments on the watch and would definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: KarL

customer_reviews.title: Good watch,hard to see.
customer_reviews.text: The watch overall is a good watch,BUT ! The "leather band" seemed to be rubberized leather and I am not sure if it will last.The photo shows a watch that is easy to see but the hands are small and steel colored and against the black background and the white numbers the hands are hard to see in normal light.The light is OK but with that black background really not necessary.If the hands were the color of the numbers the watch would be much more functional and easy to see.
customer_reviews.author: Bennon

customer_reviews.title: Great watch!
customer_reviews.text: have purchased multiple Timex watches like this one that you can't replace the battery. Love the ease of reading the time (at the age of 69) and the indigo lighting (which I have even used to navigate to the bathroom at night). And w/ this version I don't have to buy a new one every 2-3 yrs because I can now replace the battery when it dies! Did I mention that it is a fairly priced Chonometor, not some fancy bauble to hang on your wrist to make a statement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really like it
customer_reviews.text: In an age where a lot of watches look like they've been lifted out of a Transformers movie, these weekenders are a breath of fresh air. Maybe I'm already a dinosaur, but I really love the simple, well-proportioned design. The 'tick' is noticeable in a small room, but I grew up on ticking watches, and don't mind. Others have complained about this -- I guess it's a thing that will either bother you or it won't. And if you think it will? My local wally world carries Timex watches, and I checked out the ticking there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best watch I've ever owned (and I've had a lot)
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy wearing different watches with different outfits, so I own several different styles. I purchased this same Timex watch years ago and it has outlasted many much more expensive watches, so when the band wore out I decided to order another. I love the fact that when I wake up in the middle of the night I can press the stem and it lights up so I can see what time it is. I get lots of compliments on it, and It's an amazing value to boot.
customer_reviews.author: alice

customer_reviews.title: An inexpensive watch with few features....
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted a lightweight watch to wear while walking. I start my walk just before dawn and the fact that the face is not backlit is not a problem as it's usually light outside within a few minutes and in all fairness, it is not a feature I considered when I made the purchase. However, the face is heavier than I had anticipated but the strap is perfect as it is made out of cloth. Relatively inexpensive, so in short, I got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Nature Lover2

customer_reviews.title: $10 dollar watch sold for $30
customer_reviews.text: After 12 days of ownership, the strap clasp broke which then made the watch fall face first onto concrete, which some how broke the Indiglo feature. Up to that point, I had very much enjoyed the watch. Unfortunately for Timex, I will never by a product of theirs ever again. A broken strap is not covered by the warranty, meaning the INDIGLO will never get repaired. I have a $10 Japanese watch that is better then this over priced American watch.
customer_reviews.author: Akroma

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: The watch is very small and difficult to read due to the reflective hands. The strap is extremely cheap and should be replaced. It seemed to lose a minute or two every day. Eventually returned it.
customer_reviews.author: JVoorhees

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch, one flaw
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about this watch....[Almost] Classic look, weight, accurate, a bit big for my taste but good on the wrist, However, one major flaw...I bought one with a black dial and the hands are too indistinct to be able to easily read this watch. In the stock photos, the hands stand out, in reality they are wispy, thin and a silver color that drops out in most lighting. That means you'll be cocking your wrist at many angles to actually tell the time. Thinking black dial? Pick another color...Any other color dial? Then this is a classic, well priced watch.
customer_reviews.author: Arcct

customer_reviews.title: Hands almost invisible in bright light
customer_reviews.text: I'm downgrading my rating to one star because the hands are very difficult to see in bright light, even indoors. I'd return the purchase but the deadline has expired. Original review: A good watch, with one issue: the silver hands are nearly invisible in bright daylight. I have to cup a hand around the face to figure out what time it is. In lower light, no problem. But that's a serious disadvantage when outside in the sun.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew G. Lang

customer_reviews.title: My go-to watch for traveling and nightclubbing!
customer_reviews.text: Great watch, the NATO strap sold me, as well as the backlit dial. I have several expensive, hi-beat watches, but for some reason, I have started wearing this one when I perform in dark clubs. The crown/pushbutton light works well, and gives me the data I need easily, especially in places where use of a cellphone is not allowed. Easy to set, light wearing on the wrist and water resistant (I haven't swam or showered with it on).
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K.

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy having an analog watch
customer_reviews.text: This is the first analog watch I've bought for myself, and I'm enjoying it so far. Unlike some other reviewers, I don't find the ticking loud at all. In fact, it's actually kind of soothing and meditative, something constant to settle my mind on throughout the day. The nylon strap was a little itchy and tight at first, but like a good pair of shoes, the fabric is beginning to stretch, soften, and adjust to daily wear.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent watch
customer_reviews.text: Having very serious macular degeneration I struggle to read a watch. This watch I can see to read. I worried it would be to big for my little wrists, but it fits and looks great. I am extremely happy with this watch, and I do recommend it. The band is also very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Practical and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This watch more than met my expectations. The hands are easily read and it's so comfortable that I often forget I'm wearing it. I typically have difficulty finding bands that fit well because my wrists are a bit small. This band has holes that are close enough to adjust it very well. I'm so happy with it. The one thing I found surprising was that if I sit with my wrist close to my head, I can actually hear it tick. I find it kind of comforting but someone looking for a silent watch may not.
customer_reviews.author: Tish

customer_reviews.title: Great watch...loud ticking
customer_reviews.text: Great watch. Feel great on my wrist, goes with button down shirts for work and casual wear. Looks smart and clean. The ticking is loud. How loud? At night, I cover it with a shirt in my bedroom so I don't hear it from across the room. You won't notice anything going about your daily life, but once you get into a dead quiet situation, you will hear it. Not a deal breaker for me, but something you should be aware of if you value silence.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D.

customer_reviews.title: Great watch at a fantastic price point
customer_reviews.text: Great watch at a fantastic price point! Very easy to customize the strap as well. The only issue I (well, my wife) has with it is that it is loud when it tics. It was my first wristwatch since I started carrying a smart phone, so I don't have anything to compare it against, but I don't think it's out of spec in any way.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Gardner

customer_reviews.title: US A-11 style Pilot Watch Quartz Works, inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: The A-11 pilot watch was just 12 numbers, each minute marked, three hands and luminous. The only two differences here is that this watch uses Timex's Indglo back lighting and they added the 24 hour numbers. This a great homage to the original. I have seen similar mechanicals going for over $600 with an accuracy rating of between =/- 12 to 30 seconds a day. Why when this watch is +/- 5 seconds per week for less than $50?
customer_reviews.author: Edward E. Hillenbrand

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Watch
customer_reviews.text: Excellent watch. I have several fairly costly watches that can handle different time zones, connect to the National Time Service in Boulder etc., But for simplicity, ease of use, and cost-effectiveness, this is hard to beat. Most import to me was the Indiglo feature which makes seeing the time in the dark foolproof. So far the watch seems to keep accurate time. The band is simple but attractive. It fits my average size wrist well with only a slight excess remaining beyond the second buckle. Given the low cost and excellent appearance it is very difficult to fault this product.
customer_reviews.author: ACAT

customer_reviews.title: Just what I sought (maybe a little more)
customer_reviews.text: I'm going on a long hike this summer, and won't take my cellphone. No Kindle, no email, no connectivity at all. Haven't worn a watch in 20 years. Still need to know what time it is, though. I liked the look of this watch online, $30 seemed reasonable, so I ordered one. I set it to my iPhone, and after 4 hours it is on to the SECOND. I like the actual look of it even better than the pics. I'm happy. Edit: 2 weeks out, still exactly tracking iPhone, to the second. 9 seconds different, with no adjustment. Dead silent too. For $30?! Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Great looking watch, loud ticker
customer_reviews.text: I got this watch for my husband who wanted to go "phoneless" post work and be more engaged with our kids. Great! It looks spiffy on and he's had it for about 6 months and it looks like new after everyday use. The ticker is loud though. If he leaves it on his dresser at night, I usually have to get out of bed and bury it in his underwear drawer. But I am just like that being a light sleeper.
customer_reviews.author: Mamashebear

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again
customer_reviews.text: This watch is very sleek. The band is fabric and super comfortable, I prefer reading the time in 24 hour format however the hour hand covers the 24 hour format numbering which makes that option kind of redundant but whatever, nice quality watch for 30 bucks. Update: After using this watch for about half a year the face of the watch has becoming hazy in the middle, presumably due to sitting in the sun and it makes looking at the time in certain lighting conditions blurry now. However, it still works so I only deducted one star.
customer_reviews.author: GrRecrot

customer_reviews.title: Great watch but loud
customer_reviews.text: Great find and very unique looking Weekender. I have been wearing this for two months now and I love it. Looks like it would be more expensive than it is. Decent quality and there are many compliments to be had while wearing. The indiglo feature is a nice positive. It would be a 5 stars but this watch is so loud. You can hear the ticking from quite a distance away. This is my second Timex watch and I guess it must be a trademark of the brand but it really is quite annoying. I have several Seiko watches and they are quiet. Honestly, this is too beautiful a watch to make a loud ticking noise.
customer_reviews.author: JU5T1N

customer_reviews.title: No frills
customer_reviews.text: Had a smartwatch that became useless over the years so I got to thinking what's the point really. This watch is cheap and looks good. It tells time. It's no frills and utilitarian which I think is a good thing in our modern world of excess.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Mccormick

customer_reviews.title: Great Simple Watch
customer_reviews.text: I just got this watch and so far I love it. The strap is soft and a great width. The watch face is a little large but definitely not too large, even though I have small wrists. I was excited for this watch because it’s causal design and ability to change straps. It will be great for me to wear to work (preschool teacher) and not have to worry about getting wet every time I was my hands or do a messy activity. I can’t speak for the longevity yet, but I would recommend it to anyone who wants a simple watch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: The “keepers” which hold down the excess band aren’t adjustable as they are on most watches. If you have smaller wrists, there will be a lot of extra band length which just dangles on the end with nothing to hold it down. So if you have smaller-than-average wrists (as I do) it may not be for you. That said, it’s a Timex, so I’m sure the watch is of great quality and reliable. I just returned for aesthetic reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a budding Scout!
customer_reviews.text: It was bought for my 12 year old, beginning to want to wear a watch! Perfect for his test whether he would continue to wear one, and doesn’t break the bank. Good quality overall and looks and works as a good watch should. Night light feature is unique to timex watches and I must admit it’s highly practical. For a kid who is a scout this is perfect watch, can handle the outdoor abuses. No brainer!
customer_reviews.author: Roger that!

customer_reviews.title: A perfect retort to the useless smart watch craze
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, simple design that does what its supposed to. I find the clear numerals and high contrast very easy to read at a glance. Accurate - haven't had to adjust it except for daylight savings. This watch doesn't try to be fancy, and doesn't add anything that should not be in a watch - it's understated, and practical, and it tells time. There are tons of NATO bands to try, to change up the look. As others have noted, the ticking is indeed loud enough to notice, but I find it comforting :) if that might bother you, perhaps you should look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Gosh

customer_reviews.title: This is a watch that shows you the time. It's all I need.
customer_reviews.text: It's a simple, easy to read watch with the bare necessity in a watch: the ability to tell time. There's no stopwatch, or timer, or alarm, or date function and that's just the way I like it. I just wanted a simple watch. I'm an analog guy in a digital world, where everybody else has the latest smart watch that can do XYZ and I'm still cool with using the old school tech. I also like that it has an interchangeable band so you can change the band color to fit your mood. Along with the watch, I also purchased a set of different colored straps.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan M Morse

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: I am a watch guy, and have many affordable, quality watches. I received this Timex for Christmas and really like it. The metal finish was well done, the watch dial has numbers and a neat beveled edge with minute markings. The band is a ballistic nylon I think. The Indiglo light works adequately in low light, even with the black dial. Overall a great watch for the price. Timex has really turned it around the last few years and make nice watches.
customer_reviews.author: Jack B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I haven't worn a watch for a long time as when it's warm out, I don't like the feeling on my wrist, sweaty and the watch sticks to my skin. I decided to try this watch as it has a canvas band, the canvas wraps through/under the watch face, so that's what is on my skin. I like it better already. I also wanted a bigger face, easier to read, and it's a cool blue indiglo. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Janne

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read for elderly.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 88 year old father. I wanted to get him the Timex easy reader but didn't like the band options, he doesn't need the heavy and bulky steel bracelet links and the leather would stay wet when he washed his hands, so this watch was the one I choose. The nylon band is lightweight and comfortable. The dial is large and numbers are easy to read for him. I wish it was offered without the military time but it's still very minimalistic.
customer_reviews.author: N.S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I wear these as work watches on construction sites. They handle a beating, my only complaint is the cost of a quality replacement strap is 2/3 the price of the entire watch. The backlight is terrific. I'd recommend this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Pierce J Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I like this watch a lot more than I thought I would. As a matter of fact, I'm wearing it now. I like the face a lot, but of course, that's a matter of taste. Another great feature of this watch is one it DOESN'T have, and that is day and date. this makes setting the time a matter of seconds- very handy. The nylon band has about a hundred holes making it easy to het the strap just the right length.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Wessel

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, love the military time. It's pretty big for a women. You can always count on Timex with the Indiglo
customer_reviews.text: I needed a watch for work and I really like having military time also on the watch. I have a very small 6" wrist so it looked rather large on me. The bezel is 1 3/8 inch however the strap still tightened enough although it was excessively long. I cut the nylon strap and used a lighter to fuse the ends.I thought the nylon strap was to thin for the size of the bezel so I ordered a new leather band for it. This one from Amazon and its very heavy duty and what a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and functional watch.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this watch. My other Timex bit the dust after four years and this is a good-looking replacement for it. I have swapped out the nylon webbed band for a leather one which upgrades the look a bit; no complaints. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Reality Based Skeptic

customer_reviews.title: Good watch, but smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t have this watch long, but it was nice. It looked sharp and kept time. The reason I am giving it 4 stars is because the 38mm Weekender is pretty small. I don’t have large wrists for a guy and the watch still appeared like I was wearing a woman’s watch. I ended up buying the 40mm Weekender...it was definitely a better size, though I wouldn’t wanted anything smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Florappaloosier

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and sturdy for traveling
customer_reviews.text: Kept in crossbody bag while in Europe and on cruise, shore excurstions, etc. Dont like to wear a watch and not always convenient to use or see my smart phone, so needed a watch because we had to stay on ship time, and satellite's change your phone based on what location, country etc you are in. So this worked great. Inexpensive and sturdy. Easy to read time and has lighted face to see easily during night.
customer_reviews.author: Aunt Susie

customer_reviews.title: Nice, simple watch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a back-up watch or "weekend" watch if you will. I didn't expect much for 30 dollars, but I'm actually fairly impressed with the overall presentation. It is simple, but I expect it will be fairly reliable too. There's no date or anything. The only real feature is the Indiglo light which lights up the entire watch face and is actually pretty nice. The Nato style band is nice. I just wish the nylon was a little bit thicker.
customer_reviews.author: C4pluS

customer_reviews.title: great watch for the price
customer_reviews.text: watch is built solid, band is lightweight and comfortable. light could be brighter but still works well. could definitely wear in rain or if you work in the weather like I do sweat shouldn't be a problem. I'd say it's damn good for the price. if you want a watch that looks good and can stand up to rain and sweat you can't go wrong here. I chose the black band because it will not show oil or sweat stains.
customer_reviews.author: mrrebel

customer_reviews.title: Nice Watch
customer_reviews.text: I really like the watch itself but the band, not so much. Mind you, it’s good quality, just not my style. So I also purchased a Wocci silicone rubber aftermarket band and now love this set up. The indigo is fantastic and I’ve had no trouble with the watch itself. Like many others have said, it is a ‘ticker’ meaning it’s a bit louder than most watches. Outside of that, this is the perfect watch for me.
customer_reviews.author: JRob

customer_reviews.title: So nice, I've bought them twice... or like 4 times now.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly the watch I was looking for. I've had a few of these over the years, and keep coming back to them. Most recently the lady of the sea claimed my watch as her own (AKA, I lost it in the ocean). Now that I've got a new one, I don't feel naked anymore. Love the grey/orange colorway, and the canvas band just can't be beat. The leather ones I just don't like as much. Sure, there are watched with more features, but for >$40, this one tells the time, (and in the dark, love that indiglo). Great watch.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Green

customer_reviews.title: Not a weekender but a field watch.
customer_reviews.text: Unlike 40mm counterpart this is a heavy solid watch. You have to see it and feel it to believe how solid this watch feels compared to other Timex watches which I have about 20. Actually I find the weight a bit Bothersome. That’s how heavy it is compared to the size. Bold like an Easy Reader and solid heavy watch. Or so the canvas watch a strap is very comfortable unlike si or so the canvas watch strap is very comfortable unlike Seiko ones.
customer_reviews.author: IjakdoTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a really durable watch, easy to read, light fixture is a great bonus for my job! I have gone through 3 watches in the last year (yes, it's alot, but my job requires one and its going to go through alot.) This watch is everything I was hoping it would be, large and durable. It's a bit loud but I don't care, Im not usually in a silent room, which is the only time i hear it.
customer_reviews.author: rkins

customer_reviews.title: the price was great on this particular one
customer_reviews.text: the price was great on this particular one. i do not understand the different prices for basically the same watch with a different color band, because it is basically the same watch. i think this is my 3rd or 4th weekender watch. i wore out the others and cracked the face on my last one. it still kept time and was basically waterproof, but the indiglo light wore out. these are good watches and a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Clynch

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised.....Simple and Clean Lines
customer_reviews.text: The watch is great-exactly what I wanted. I do wish the watch was a little larger, so I am looking at a Timex with a 43mm face.. I do have issues with the condition of the package as received. The watch was shipped in a padded envelope that appeared to have seen multiple uses as there were other shippers addresses on the package. The box containing the watch was ripped and bent. The watch was loose inside-it was not mounted on the plastic assy which holds the watch. VERY UNHAPPY with quality control.!!!!
customer_reviews.author: DENNIS227

customer_reviews.title: Loud, Slippy and leaked at 7 meters.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something simple to keep track of time with while kayaking, SUP, etc. This watch looks great, but its performance was disappointing. The ticking of the second hand, as other's have mentioned, is loud and distracting. The band style and material leaves the watch sliding around your wrist unless you tighten it to the point of leaving an impression. I also accidentally dropped this watch into 7 meters of water one time and condensation started forming on the inside of the face thereafter.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a ver handsome watch. The band is a little less lime green and more olive drab. The face, second hand, hands, numerals all look classic and outstanding. The indigo is awesome. Some have noted that the watch is loud (ticking). I really haven’t noticed it. I have a small wrist and the watch fits perfectly. Not too big as some modern watches seem to be. It is just about the perfect thickness too. It is an exceptional watch for the price. This is going to be my everyday and weekend watch.
customer_reviews.author: TheAlf

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but looks great for dressing up or down
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the grey face with orange band. The band is very soft. Not as heavy duty material as my non timex band for my other timex watch I wear. I love the looks of the watch. For $30 I can’t complain much. I have a few extra black and blue bands I can attach to it if need be for other outfits. Will update how the watch is holding up in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Nickels

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read
customer_reviews.text: Fits great! The watch has various holes to find the perfect fit. The color is just as it looks online. Love the indigo option although I didn't realize it only stays illuminated when you push in the side button. I think i'd be nice if it stayed on the at least 3 seconds or something of the like. I really like the fact that it is very easy to read and you can swap out the bands on a daily basis with ease! Someone commented the watch "ticks" too loudly but I have yet to notice and my hearing is excellent:) I highly recommend this watch!
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina P

customer_reviews.title: Simple and functional
customer_reviews.text: Good, solid watch. It looks nice enough to wear for work, but still functional for anything else throughout the day. If you are looking for a casual watch, I'm not sure there is a better deal around. It keeps time quite well, too. I have had no issues there. I'll deduct a star because it really is quite loud once you are in a quiet place. It doesn't bother me too much, but my fiance could hear it the bedroom from my nightstand so now it lives in the bathroom at night.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I like the classic value of a Timex--I have one that was built in 1974 and is still running. I have a small frame, and so the watchface is a bit large, but the look is sporty without looking like a rubber sports watch (I don't like those). I do like the band--my wrist is small, so it's nice not to have to remove chainlinks or punch in a new hole. I bought the black on black model. I hope the battery holds up--I will update my review if it disappoints.
customer_reviews.author: Fabulous FinnTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Stylish, durable, great value. Cons: It's loud. Not a problem for me, but you'll hear it if you don't have other ambient noise. I got the leather strap, and it's a bit flimsy on the end after a bit. But again, nothing terrible. Overall, Great watch for the style and function. Easy to read, comfortable, and light works good.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Molano

customer_reviews.title: Okay basic watch
customer_reviews.text: I heard a lot about the Weekender, and thought I would finally buy one. The watch is much smaller than I thought it would be. I have skinny wrists, and this almost looks kid size (1-1/2" DIA). I like the black dial, but the hands look cheap. The hands reflect light which can make them hard to see. I don't mind the loud ticking, not a big deal. The band is nothing special, but can be easily replaced. This won't be my go to watch, and I don't think I'll buy again.
customer_reviews.author: ZZrider

customer_reviews.title: Not silent
customer_reviews.text: I can't put my hand anywhere near my face anymore if I don't want to hear a contant tic- tic -tic. I was sleeping and accidentally raised my arm by my pillow in the middle of the night only to then be awoken by the ticking. Otherwise I am happy with it. Band is super comfortable and easy to change if necessary. Large and easy to read face.
customer_reviews.author: WhoAmI?

customer_reviews.title: Hands are not gray like the picture shows, but made of reflective material.
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a fan of Timex, and I especially love the Weekender collection. This is a great looking watch (I got the one with the Black/Gray Stripe band). My only complaint is that I thought the hands were gray like the picture showed. The picture was a bit misleading. The hands were not gray - they had more of a reflective surface, which, in certain lighting, makes it difficult to tell the time in a glance. I'm planning on exchanging it for one with black hands so there's enough contrast with the white background. Great looking watch overall.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron M.

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is the third watch from this line Ive purchased in the past 5 years. For the price this is perfect for me. Simple and easy to read. Backlight works well in the dark. Have actually gotten more complements on this watch that I have on my nicer dress watches. Only complaint is that the band tends to fray after 4 years of daily use.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hallen

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: FOR THE MONEY, TIMEX CAN NOT BE BEAT. THE TIME IS ACCURATE AND THE WATCH IS EASY TO READ. THE INDIGO LIGHT IS A NICE FEATURE. I LIKE THIS ONE BECAUSE IT GIVES THE MILITARY TIME AS WELL AS REGULAR TIME. THE REMOVABLE WATCH BAND IS NICE AS A LOT OF TIMES I USE THIS AS A POCKET WATCH. DOES NOT HAVE THE DATE SETTING, BUT I DON'T NEED IT. OVERALL A GREAT WATCH
customer_reviews.author: TERRY AND BILL ECKMAN

customer_reviews.title: Tik tok
customer_reviews.text: Looks just like photo, the face is easy to read, and the nylon strap dries out quickly after washing hands and whatnot. I can't hear the ticking when I'm standing with my arm at my side, but do hear it when its any closer, so I knocked off a star for that annoyance (I think I have pretty typical hearing for a 41 year old?). It's also larger and heavier than I expected, which I realize is my fault because I read the description and didn't take measurements. See photo for comparison: I wear a women's size L gloves and my wrist is just about 7 inches around.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten S.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch a little over a year ago. The only reason I remembered to write a review is because I found it in the washer today and it was fine. I'm a firefighter/EMT so I wear my watch all the time, and sometimes under harsh conditions (rain, heat, etc). The indiglo is awesome, it's easy to read. Just wash the band out with hydrogen peroxide once every few months cause it will get to smelling if you sweat alot. It's a minimalist utilitarian watch, which I personally like about it. Five stars for durability ( not the first time I've washed it)
customer_reviews.author: Doug Howard

customer_reviews.title: I really loved this watch.
customer_reviews.text: I really loved everything about this watch. It works great, it looks great it and it holds time well. The problem is that this is not a stainless steel watch as advertised. It's made out of some kind of junk metal with a silver plating. Normally this wouldn't bother me but I have a huge rash around my wrist because of it. So basically I can't use this watch. I bought it for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Neuser

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. Yes, the band does fray around the holes quickly, which is annoying (and why I gave four stars instead of five), but the watch itself is perfect -- large, attractive face that feels good on my wrist. I sleep in this watch and use the Indiglo to check on my children at night or light my way to the bathroom and it's perfect -- not too bright, super easy to use. I'd buy this again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah P. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great line of watches, but this color is hard to read.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Weekender by Timex and I'm still sold on the design. Simple and functional....but each time I pick a different color scheme and this time I picked the wrong one. The medium gray face is too neutral so the dark hands don't stand out, the white numbers don't stand out. The white face models are a better choice.
customer_reviews.author: Photographer

product_meta.title: Timex Unisex Weekender 38mm Watch
product_meta.description:
Are you ready for the weekend? This is the perfect watch when you just feel like being yourself. A textured play on our classic Weekender collection gives you fun options to customize your straps depending on your outfit or mood.




PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Product Dimensions :3.94 x 3.94 x 5.91 inches; 1.6 Ounces
 * Item model number :T2N649
 * Department :Unisex-adult
 * Batteries :1 Lithium Metal batteries required. (included)
 * Date First Available :October 11, 2011
 * Manufacturer :Timex
 * ASIN :B008T9QG7K

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #3,406 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry (See Top 100 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry)  *  #1868 inWomen's Shops 
    *  #8 inMen's Wrist Watches 
    *  #943 inMen's Shops 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.5 out of 5 stars11,118 ratings Are you ready for the weekend? This is the perfect watch when you just feel like being yourself. A textured play on our classic Weekender collection gives you fun options to customize your straps depending on your outfit or mood.
feature_bullets: Adjustable gray & orange striped 20mm nylon slip-thru strap fits up to 8-inch wrist circumference
Gray dial with full Arabic numerals; 24-hour military time
Silver-tone 38mm brass case with mineral glass crystal
Water resistant to 30m (100ft): in general, withstands splashes or brief immersion in water, but not suitable for swimming or bathing
